texts.text: After today's classes, Sumomo stands at the podium again and does the usual ceremony to finish the day.
That's another day down.
Only one more, and it'll finally be over.
It feels weird coming to class after so much time away.
Did each day always feel this long?
I'm amazed by how everyone can just sit on these chairs for hours on end.
After being out of the school loop for only three months, I feel like I've lost something that comes naturally to everyone else.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: As you may know, we have the end of semester ceremony tomorrow. Not long until summer break now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: See you all tomorrow.
My classmates leave the room in a steady stream.
I grab my bag and get ready to leave too.
I want to give Sumomo the photo I printed out yesterday.
After her whole teaching practice thing is over, I might never see her again.
I leave the classroom together with everyone else.
I chase after Sumomo at a light jog.
But then, I hear her voice coming from the landing.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm sorry...

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: I'll have you know we get people like you every year. Kids thinking they can become teachers, just like you.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: I'm actually amazed at how useless you are. Don't you think you should be attending classes rather than teaching them?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm sorry. I've never been that good at studying...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But! I, err, I did all I could... I really tried hard, and I...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I thought that'd help me get the note I needed to graduate...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I did everything asked of me, even if it wasn't all perfect.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: What was that?
Is she talking about me?
She was happy about her evaluation improving because I came to class.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Nothing... Never mind.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: Your type always wants to be judged on effort alone, regardless of whether you actually achieve anything.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: The process matters squat. It's the result that matters.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I...

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Nothing... Never mind.
The teacher's footsteps grow fainter as he walks away.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: *Sigh*
Sumomo's sad sigh floats down to me.
I look up the stairs.
I catch a glimpse of Sumomo slowly climbing up them.
Oh man.
I really am screwed.
I did my best, even dressing up to look the part of whatever they expected of me.
I really tried, in my own way.
But if the process doesn't matter and it's just about results, what about bringing Kanna back?
Do I need to tell them about it to make it clear?
Nah, I can't.
To be honest, I did bring him back so I could use it as a bargaining chip.
But it feels like I'm using him as a tool, and I hate that.
Maybe I've gotten too close to him?
Ugh. If I knew this was gonna happen, I wouldn't have made a fool of myself and dragged Kanna into this in the first place.
I follow Sumomo up to the rooftop.
Looking around, I see her leaning against the handrail.
Taking the photo out of my bag, I walk over to her.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sumomo.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, Kanna. What's this?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Take a look.
Clearly a little surprised, she accepts the photo from me.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Pretty good, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Do I really smile like this?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: When you're in the garage and the terminal, yeah.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I haven't seen it once here at the academy, though.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's the best photo I've ever taken.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really?! I'm so happy to hear that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I want to thank you.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? F-For what?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: My goal has always been to take pictures that make people feel something. That's what makes me happy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And ever since I started coming to class, I've been talking a little more with Dad.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really? Things are better with your daddy now?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thank goodness! Did you make up?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Not quite, I don't think.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Aw. But talking to each other is start!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Some good things happened too.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Good things that happened because you brought me to class, I mean.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mm...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's all. After tomorrow, we might not see each other again.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So I wanted you to know that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And I wanted you to know that... you have a really nice smile.
I say, as I look down at the picture she's holding.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thanks.
Sumomo smiles fondly at her own picture.
I see a faint hint of a blush touch her face.
I'm glad I handed her the photo so she can take a good look at herself.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I think... you should always look like you do in that photo.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Do you like me better the way I look in this photo?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: More than now, sure.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah!
After letting out a hearty laugh, she traces her own smile in the picture.
She's the first person to look at one of my pictures with such passion.
Realizing that the corners of my mouth curling into a dopey grin, I snap back to reality and shake my head.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So, I guess I should get going.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thank you.
She says, as I walk back.
When I turn around, I see her holding my photograph in both hands with a wide smile on her face.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I have some tidying up to do, not to mention I can see some teacher chewing me out again, so I probably won't have time to come by the garage.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So I'll see you tomorrow.
I just answer her with a nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Man, I sure look like I'm having fun.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm just wide open, so he reads me like a book. Is that what Azuki means when she calls me a bitch? Heheh.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Still...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This really is me, huh? The real me...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I did it.
After we part in the rooftop, I head straight back home and into Hachimaru.
I'm almost done sorting through the albums now.
At least, I have most of the camp sites we visited together listed out.
There are a few albums still stacked on the desk.
Sticky notes poke out from them.
I'm using them to mark locations I can't remember or identify at all.
I look at my list.
There are less than forty candidates.
I look at Mom's sketch that I found inside Hachimaru.
She probably drew it with a pencil.
The paper itself is all wavy in places, as if it had gotten wet and then dried out.
Maybe it was out in the mountain air.
Looks like a place with conifers.
It doesn't quite look like a cave, but it looks like a view from some kind of hole.
Where in the world is this place?
I refocus on the albums on my desk.
There's actually someone nearby that remembers all of these places better than me.
My dad.
Maybe I should go to the house and ask him.
I could save myself all this hassle. He might recognize the place at a glance.

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: That'll be one surprise for 2061!
I remember her cheeky grin.
A wry smile comes to my own lips.
Asking my dad should be a last resort.
I still have time.
This is the last game between Mom and me.
I take a deep breath.
It'll be fine.
For now at least, things are moving in the right direction.
Hachimaru will be back on the roads soon enough.
It actually was back on them not so long ago.
If I figure out the location, I can have Azuki drive me there.
This plan is actually looking realistic now.
I'll turn to my dad only after I've exhausted all other options.
Then, this summer...
I'll finally show him that I'm not a kid anymore.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Ah. Crank out a lot today?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Not again!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hahah!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Peach isn't coming today?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, the semester ends tomorrow, so she has some stuff to do.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: How's the car looking?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The chassis is fine. We'd have a real problem on our hands if it were bent.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's good.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Maybe I'll go ahead and steal it again while I have the chance, before your summer break starts.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're really starting to piss me off!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You've got steam coming out of your ears already.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You better not steal it!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: If I was really trying to steal it, I wouldn't be joking about it.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Besides, I don't want some brat burning my house down all over again.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Come on! I ain't gonna steal it!
It's been two weeks since my teacher training began.
This painful experience ends today.
I see my reflection in the mirror.
The reflection of the same person I've seen every morning for the last two weeks.
Me, all put together in my smart suit.
My training ends today.
I just need to go to the classroom one more time and use the most monotone voice I can. Don't leave an impression on anyone.
I sit by the window just like yesterday.
Then I'll get my teaching license.
It doesn't matter if I really get a job as a teacher.
All I need is the qualification.
Then Mom's husband will finally stop making her life hard.
But...
I can't get Kanna's photo out of my mind.
I can't believe I'm smiling like this.
I love it.
I like this me.
I want to be like this.
If I were, I'm sure...
No matter what happened, I could overcome it.
If Mom cried again...
I could tell her that everything's gonna be okay.
I could smile and laugh for her until she stopped.
I'd be so dazzling, she'd forget what she was even crying about.
And then we'd laugh together.
Hah, that's it.
That's fine.
That's what I can do for my mom.
Whatever her partner says to her...
And whatever she feels about it...
There's no way I can influence that. I can't fix him being a douche.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Idiot.
I call myself out in the mirror.
I'm so stupid.
This is what happens when I try to use the brain I obviously don't have.
What's with this stupid costume?
I drop my bag by my feet.
The huge bag full of all the pretty clothes I love.
This is the last time.
I held on for today. I endured it all.
I may be stupid, but I tried damn hard.
For the last time...
It's okay if I go out in a blaze of beauty, right?
After the end of term ceremony in the gymnasium is finished, we're back in the classroom waiting for our last homeroom period.
The last moment of the last day I promised to Sumomo.
It feels like it passed by so slowly, yet so fast at the same time.
No, I think I'll go with slowly. It did drag on.
Sumomo won't have much reason to visit the garage anymore.
I look out of the window, remembering the afternoons we hung out together.
I'm still looking outside when the bell rings and the classroom door opens.
So it takes me a moment to notice something's different.
Complete silence fills the classroom.
Just like the first time I came into the room.
I turn to the podium.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Ah...
Curiously enough, I'm the one that breaks the silence in the room.
I couldn't help but voice my surprise.
Sumomo...
She heads to the podium, her long white hair fluttering as she goes.
No one in the classroom seems to understand what's going on.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thank you so much for the last two weeks, everyone.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, I'm Momonouchi, by the way.
I hear murmurs from all over the classroom.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I've always hated long graduation speeches a whole lot.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So I'm pretty much standing here not really knowing what to say to you all.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I mean, we're pretty much forty total strangers gathered here. I've no idea what any of you like.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Looking back, I sure wish we had the chance to get to know one another better.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But nah. Feels like it's better not to force myself to do things I'm not used to.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I've met some people since I got here, and I also realized some things.
Sumomo glances my way as she says it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sometimes it's actually good to force yourself to do new stuff.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm glad I tried this out. But I've come to the conclusion that I should leave teaching to those who are better suited to it than me.
The teacher sitting at the back of the classroom is simply staring at her with his mouth hanging open. I even spy the gleam of a silver tooth inside his mouth.
I reach out and grab the camera from inside my bag.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Make sure you enjoy your summer break! And do your best with those entrance exams! Oh, wait. This academy doesn't have those, does it?
Sumomo glances my way.
I nod back.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're incredible! All of you! Yep, I hope for only the best in your lives. And I'll go back to my weird life.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Let's all walk our own paths and do the best we can!
I point my camera toward the smiling Sumomo.
She notices and throws up a peace sign for me.
And I take the picture.
All the other students turn to me.
Sumomo then steps down from the podium and walks out.
I put the camera back in my bag and look out the window again.
Shortly after, the teacher at the back of the room follows her out into the corridor.
As soon as he's gone, the classroom explodes with noise.
I'm taken aback.
Is it that big of a deal how someone looks?
I imagine they would faint if they saw how Azuki looks when she wakes up.
But...
I saw something really interesting today.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Ah...
Sumomo and the teacher from before are sitting at a table in the cafe by the entrance to the academy.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: What the hell are you thinking?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm so sorry!

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: Do you really even want to be a teacher?! You're not taking any of this seriously!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Nah, I just don't think it's for me after all.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: How many times did I tell you to write down what you want to say before class?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I did kind of do that, though.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: And what's with that hair?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's my real hair.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: You fucking with me?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's just my hair, geez.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: What kind of parents raised a mess like you?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This has nothing to do with them.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: It does, you dumb bimbo. Everything that's wrong with people comes from their upbringing.
He's scolding her so loudly I can hear every word even from over here.
Does he really need to go off on her here of all places?
It's a public space, and there are people around.
I mean, I can't deny that Sumomo's classes were a complete mess.
And it's true she can be a little brazen, not to mention scatterbrained.
And above all, she's dumb enough to throw everything away right before the finish line.
But it still makes me so mad.
She should talk back, but she's just sitting there taking his bullshit.
Before I even realize what I'm doing, I'm walking up to her.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Miss Sumomo.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?
Both of them turn to me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You kept your promise, didn't you?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Promise?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I came back to the academy for the last week, just like you promised him.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You should remind him of that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You were told to bring me in, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And you were told that you'd get your license if I came back to class, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Make him keep his end of the bargain.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: Hey, Amei, that's now how you talk to your teachers.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm not talking to you.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Imagine dumping your responsibilities on Sumomo because you can't be bothered to do your job.

texts.name: Male Teacher
texts.text: You...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sumomo kept her promise, didn't she? That has nothing to do with what she looks like.
After I finish saying my part to the slack-jawed teacher, I turn to Sumomo again.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You better get what's yours. Make sure you didn't endure looking and feeling like crap for nothing.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Now that you actually have the guts to be who you are...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There's nothing else to fear, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahahah!
Turning my back on them, I head straight for the exit.
That sure was something.
Kanna totally took me by surprise.
He was so childish when we were in the garage.
Where did that come from?
Is he actually secretly some kinda bad boy?
I watch him walk away.
He used to look so small, but now...
My heartbeat quickens.
It's thumping so hard.
Ah...
This might be kinda bad.
Kanna...
I think I'm falling for you.
I doubt you care much about that kind of thing, though.
So I'm into a younger guy, huh?
He's not that much younger, though.
He's finally out of view.
Only then do I realize that the guy on the other side of the table is yelling so loud it almost leaves me deaf on one ear.
Oh, right. I was in the middle of getting yelled at again.
He sounds even angrier than before.
Geez. Kanna sure doesn't think things through. He just made this mess then left me to deal with it.
I stand up and bow as low as I can.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm sorry! I'm really sorry about everything!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm sorry!
Good, he shut up already.
These prideful types who want nothing more than to feel superior to everyone are so easy to deal with.
I bet he didn't expect me to actually go and put myself down.
If we were back in my old job, I could get at least three bottles out of this sucker.
That's what you get for looking down on a bitch with experience.
Well then.
From today on, I'll do what I want and be the me I wanna be.
And the first thing my heart is telling me to do...
...is to chase after Kanna!
It's finally over.
I feel lighter than ever.
I don't think I've been this excited for summer break since I was a kid.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna!
Turning around, I see Sumomo chasing after me with that huge bag of hers.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Let's go back together!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm not a teacher anymore. We can walk back together.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh, that's not what I mean.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Go back where?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: To the garage. You wanna do something this summer, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, but—

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Let me help you with it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Because I wanna help you.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And I want you to take lots of cute pictures.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And I want you to tell me I'm pretty again!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What? I never said anything like that.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Grr! You SO did when you were taking pictures of me before.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Did I?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You didn't even notice?! You fucking jerk!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Err, I kind of remember, actually...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Pleeease let me help!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Pretty please?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Suit yourself.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right on! Come on, let's bounce!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What's the rush?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I hate this stinking place!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You did good lasting two whole weeks, huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! I can't believe I did that!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I like your garage lots! So let's gooo!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Okay.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hellow, Miss Scrap Hunter.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Uh, who's this?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Figures.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm Sumomo!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Peach?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: In the flesh! My teacher training is over! In more ways than one.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What's with the outfit?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I normally look like this, pretty much. The stuff from before was my boring teacher costume.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hah... Heheh!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I knew my eyes didn't deceive me! Now you're the very image of the Bitchy Peach!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You're soooo lame!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: No, I'm not!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So, spill it already! What are you trying to do, Kanna?
I go get Mom's sketch from the car.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm looking for this place.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: My mom's sketch.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: By your mom, you mean Amei Anna?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa! She was a woman of many talents!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Is that the comet we're seeing now?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Halley's Comet!
Sumomo looks really pleased with herself for some reason.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I remember!
Her smile is contagious, and I end up mirroring it.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Where's this supposed to be?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't know.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, really?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mom died before telling me.
There's a moment of silence after that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mom had been looking forward to photographing the comet for as long as I can remember.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We went camping almost every week to different places so she could search for the best place to shoot it from, since it only comes around once every 76 years.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ooh.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: With this Hachimaru here?
I nod.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Makes sense now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So she found the place while she was still alive?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: One trip, she told me that she had found the place already.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But she didn't tell me where it is.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I found the sketch inside Hachimaru after she passed.
I look up.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I want to find the place and be there the day that the comet is closest to Earth.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: On July 28th of this year, I want to take the picture she always planned to.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: On Anna's behalf, you mean?
I nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Man, that's super cool! I'm all in! Let's do this thing! It'll be like a treasure hunt!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Geez, you could've told me sooner that this car means so damn much to you.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Did you ever think that maybe I didn't wanna sell it for a reason?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Heh. Leave the car to me.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'll get it fixed up. I swear on my honor as a scrap hunter.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahahah! You're so tacky!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You wouldn't know cool if it hit you right on that empty head of yours!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Thanks.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And me?! What can I do?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I listed out all the campsites I visited with my mom. I want you to help me look them up, one by one.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This is gonna be SO fun! It's gonna be such a great summer! Maybe God is finally rewarding me for working so hard!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Wow, you can be pretty self-centered, huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm sure it'll be fun!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah! I bet!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Let's get started! We have the whole summer to look forward to! This'll be our secret project!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Operation Find Anna's Secret Spot!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Your ideas for names are almost as crap as mine! I don't wanna hear you call me lame ever again!
Sumomo's right.
The summer's just getting started for the three of us.
